title: Ticket #437: VM universe can leak VMs when Startd crashes
description:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=498497

If the startd dies the master will kill its process tree, which wipes out all processes that could clean up a running VM. The VM is outside the process tree, so it does not get killed.

Proposed fix is to leave record of the running VM for the startd to handle on startup.
remarks: Ticket #514 has an expanded explanation of this problem. I'm treating this ticket as a duplicate and resolving.
